text: XXXVIII .
text_tokenized: XXXVIII .

text: On Saturday morning Elizabeth and Mr. Collins met for breakfast a few minutes before the others appeared ; and he took the opportunity of paying the parting civilities which he deemed indispensably necessary .
text_tokenized: On Saturday morning Elizabeth and Mr. Collins met for breakfast a few minutes before the others appeared ; and he took the opportunity of paying the parting civilities which he deemed indispensably necessary .

text: “ I know not , Miss Elizabeth , ” said he , “ whether Mrs. Collins has yet expressed her sense of your kindness in coming to us ; but I am very certain you will not leave the house without receiving her thanks for it .
text_tokenized: “ I know not , Miss Elizabeth , ” said he , “ whether Mrs. Collins has yet expressed her sense of your kindness in coming to us ; but I am very certain you will not leave the house without receiving her thanks for it .

text: The favour of your company has been much felt , I assure you .
text_tokenized: The favour of your company has been much felt , I assure you .

text: We know how little there is to tempt anyone to our humble abode .
text_tokenized: We know how little there is to tempt anyone to our humble abode .

text: Our plain manner of living , our small rooms , and few domestics , and the little we see of the world , must make Hunsford extremely dull to a young lady like yourself ; but I hope you will believe us grateful for the condescension , and that we have done everything in our power to prevent you spending your time unpleasantly . ”
text_tokenized: Our plain manner of living , our small rooms , and few domestics , and the little we see of the world , must make Hunsford extremely dull to a young lady like yourself ; but I hope you will believe us grateful for the condescension , and that we have done everything in our power to prevent you spending your time unpleasantly . ”

text: Elizabeth was eager with her thanks and assurances of happiness .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was eager with her thanks and assurances of happiness .

text: She had spent six weeks with great enjoyment ; and the pleasure of being with Charlotte , and the kind attention she had received , must make _ her _ feel the obliged .
text_tokenized: She had spent six weeks with great enjoyment ; and the pleasure of being with Charlotte , and the kind attention she had received , must make _ her _ feel the obliged .

text: Mr. Collins was gratified ; and with a more smiling solemnity replied,-- “ It gives me the greatest pleasure to hear that you have passed your time not disagreeably .
text_tokenized: Mr. Collins was gratified ; and with a more smiling solemnity replied,-- “ It gives me the greatest pleasure to hear that you have passed your time not disagreeably .

text: We have certainly done our best ; and most fortunately having it in our power to introduce you to very superior society , and from our connection with Rosings , the frequent means of varying the humble home scene , I think we may flatter ourselves that your Hunsford visit can not have been entirely irksome .
text_tokenized: We have certainly done our best ; and most fortunately having it in our power to introduce you to very superior society , and from our connection with Rosings , the frequent means of varying the humble home scene , I think we may flatter ourselves that your Hunsford visit can not have been entirely irksome .

text: Our situation with regard to Lady Catherine ’s family is , indeed , the sort of extraordinary advantage and blessing which few can boast .
text_tokenized: Our situation with regard to Lady Catherine ’s family is , indeed , the sort of extraordinary advantage and blessing which few can boast .

text: You see on what a footing we are .
text_tokenized: You see on what a footing we are .

text: You see how continually we are engaged there .
text_tokenized: You see how continually we are engaged there .

text: In truth , I must acknowledge , that , with all the disadvantages of this humble parsonage , I should not think anyone abiding in it an object of compassion , while they are sharers of our intimacy at Rosings .
text_tokenized: In truth , I must acknowledge , that , with all the disadvantages of this humble parsonage , I should not think anyone abiding in it an object of compassion , while they are sharers of our intimacy at Rosings .

text: Words were insufficient for the elevation of his feelings ; and he was obliged to walk about the room , while Elizabeth tried to unite civility and truth in a few short sentences .
text_tokenized: Words were insufficient for the elevation of his feelings ; and he was obliged to walk about the room , while Elizabeth tried to unite civility and truth in a few short sentences .

text: “ You may , in fact , carry a very favourable report of us into Hertfordshire , my dear cousin .
text_tokenized: “ You may , in fact , carry a very favourable report of us into Hertfordshire , my dear cousin .

text: I flatter myself , at least , that you will be able to do so .
text_tokenized: I flatter myself , at least , that you will be able to do so .

text: Lady Catherine ’s great attentions to Mrs. Collins you have been a daily witness of ; and altogether I trust it does not appear that your friend has drawn an unfortunate -- but on this point it will be as well to be silent .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine ’s great attentions to Mrs. Collins you have been a daily witness of ; and altogether I trust it does not appear that your friend has drawn an unfortunate -- but on this point it will be as well to be silent .

text: Only let me assure you , my dear Miss Elizabeth , that I can from my heart most cordially wish you equal felicity in marriage . My dear Charlotte and I have but one mind and one way of thinking .
text_tokenized: Only let me assure you , my dear Miss Elizabeth , that I can from my heart most cordially wish you equal felicity in marriage . My dear Charlotte and I have but one mind and one way of thinking .

text: There is in everything a most remarkable resemblance of character and ideas between us .
text_tokenized: There is in everything a most remarkable resemblance of character and ideas between us .

text: We seem to have been designed for each other .
text_tokenized: We seem to have been designed for each other .

text: Elizabeth could safely say that it was a great happiness where that was the case , and with equal sincerity could add , that she firmly believed and rejoiced in his domestic comforts .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth could safely say that it was a great happiness where that was the case , and with equal sincerity could add , that she firmly believed and rejoiced in his domestic comforts .

text: She was not sorry , however , to have the recital of them interrupted by the entrance of the lady from whom they sprang .
text_tokenized: She was not sorry , however , to have the recital of them interrupted by the entrance of the lady from whom they sprang .

text: Poor Charlotte !
text_tokenized: Poor Charlotte !

text: it was melancholy to leave her to such society !
text_tokenized: it was melancholy to leave her to such society !

text: But she had chosen it with her eyes open ; and though evidently regretting that her visitors were to go , she did not seem to ask for compassion .
text_tokenized: But she had chosen it with her eyes open ; and though evidently regretting that her visitors were to go , she did not seem to ask for compassion .

text: Her home and her housekeeping , her parish and her poultry , and all their dependent concerns , had not yet lost their charms .
text_tokenized: Her home and her housekeeping , her parish and her poultry , and all their dependent concerns , had not yet lost their charms .

text: At length the chaise arrived , the trunks were fastened on , the parcels placed within , and it was pronounced to be ready .
text_tokenized: At length the chaise arrived , the trunks were fastened on , the parcels placed within , and it was pronounced to be ready .

text: After an affectionate parting between the friends , Elizabeth was attended to the carriage by Mr. Collins ; and as they walked down the garden , he was commissioning her with his best respects to all her family , not forgetting his thanks for the kindness he had received at Longbourn in the winter , and his compliments to Mr. and Mrs. Gardiner , though unknown .
text_tokenized: After an affectionate parting between the friends , Elizabeth was attended to the carriage by Mr. Collins ; and as they walked down the garden , he was commissioning her with his best respects to all her family , not forgetting his thanks for the kindness he had received at Longbourn in the winter , and his compliments to Mr. and Mrs. Gardiner , though unknown .

text: He then handed her in , Maria followed , and the door was on the point of being closed , when he suddenly reminded them , with some consternation ,
text_tokenized: He then handed her in , Maria followed , and the door was on the point of being closed , when he suddenly reminded them , with some consternation ,

text: that they had hitherto forgotten to leave any message for the ladies of Rosings .
text_tokenized: that they had hitherto forgotten to leave any message for the ladies of Rosings .

text: “ But , ” he added , “ you will of course wish to have your humble respects delivered to them , with your grateful thanks for their kindness to you while you have been here . ” Elizabeth made no objection : the door was then allowed to be shut , and the carriage drove off . “ Good gracious ! ” cried Maria , after a few minutes ’ silence , “ it seems but a day or two since we first came !
text_tokenized: “ But , ” he added , “ you will of course wish to have your humble respects delivered to them , with your grateful thanks for their kindness to you while you have been here . ” Elizabeth made no objection : the door was then allowed to be shut , and the carriage drove off . “ Good gracious ! ” cried Maria , after a few minutes ’ silence , “ it seems but a day or two since we first came !

text: and yet how many things have happened ! ”
text_tokenized: and yet how many things have happened ! ”

text: “ A great many indeed
text_tokenized: “ A great many indeed

text: , ” said her companion , with a sigh .
text_tokenized: , ” said her companion , with a sigh .

text: “ We have dined nine times at Rosings , besides drinking tea there twice !
text_tokenized: “ We have dined nine times at Rosings , besides drinking tea there twice !

text: How much I shall have to tell ! ” Elizabeth privately added , “ And how much I shall have to conceal ! ”
text_tokenized: How much I shall have to tell ! ” Elizabeth privately added , “ And how much I shall have to conceal ! ”

text: Their journey was performed without much conversation , or any alarm ; and within four hours of their leaving Hunsford they reached Mr. Gardiner ’s house , where they were to remain a few days .
text_tokenized: Their journey was performed without much conversation , or any alarm ; and within four hours of their leaving Hunsford they reached Mr. Gardiner ’s house , where they were to remain a few days .

text: Jane looked well , and Elizabeth had little opportunity of studying her spirits , amidst the various engagements which the kindness of her aunt had reserved for them .
text_tokenized: Jane looked well , and Elizabeth had little opportunity of studying her spirits , amidst the various engagements which the kindness of her aunt had reserved for them .

text: But Jane was to go home with her , and at Longbourn there would be leisure enough for observation .
text_tokenized: But Jane was to go home with her , and at Longbourn there would be leisure enough for observation .

text: It was not without an effort , meanwhile , that she could wait even for Longbourn , before she told her sister of Mr. Darcy ’s proposals .
text_tokenized: It was not without an effort , meanwhile , that she could wait even for Longbourn , before she told her sister of Mr. Darcy ’s proposals .

text: To know that she had the power of revealing what would so exceedingly astonish Jane , and must , at the same time , so highly gratify whatever of her own vanity she had not yet been able to reason away , was such a temptation to openness as nothing could have conquered , but the state of indecision in which she remained as to the extent of what she should communicate , and her fear , if she once entered on the subject , of being hurried into repeating something of Bingley , which might only grieve her sister further .
text_tokenized: To know that she had the power of revealing what would so exceedingly astonish Jane , and must , at the same time , so highly gratify whatever of her own vanity she had not yet been able to reason away , was such a temptation to openness as nothing could have conquered , but the state of indecision in which she remained as to the extent of what she should communicate , and her fear , if she once entered on the subject , of being hurried into repeating something of Bingley , which might only grieve her sister further .

text: XXXIX . It was the second week in May , in which the three young ladies set out together from Gracechurch Street for the town of ---- , in Hertfordshire ; and , as they drew near the appointed inn where Mr. Bennet ’s carriage was to meet them , they quickly perceived , in token of the coachman ’s punctuality , both Kitty and Lydia looking out of a dining - room upstairs .
text_tokenized: XXXIX . It was the second week in May , in which the three young ladies set out together from Gracechurch Street for the town of ---- , in Hertfordshire ; and , as they drew near the appointed inn where Mr. Bennet ’s carriage was to meet them , they quickly perceived , in token of the coachman ’s punctuality , both Kitty and Lydia looking out of a dining - room upstairs .

text: These two girls had been above an hour in the place , happily employed in visiting an opposite milliner , watching the sentinel on guard , and dressing a salad and cucumber .
text_tokenized: These two girls had been above an hour in the place , happily employed in visiting an opposite milliner , watching the sentinel on guard , and dressing a salad and cucumber .

text: After welcoming their sisters , they triumphantly displayed a table set out with such cold meat as an inn larder usually affords , exclaiming , “ Is not this nice ?
text_tokenized: After welcoming their sisters , they triumphantly displayed a table set out with such cold meat as an inn larder usually affords , exclaiming , “ Is not this nice ?

text: is not this an agreeable surprise ?
text_tokenized: is not this an agreeable surprise ?

text: “ And we mean to treat you all , ” added Lydia ; “ but you must lend us the money , for we have just spent ours at the shop out there . ”
text_tokenized: “ And we mean to treat you all , ” added Lydia ; “ but you must lend us the money , for we have just spent ours at the shop out there . ”

text: Then showing her purchases,--“Look here , I have bought this bonnet .
text_tokenized: Then showing her purchases,--“Look here , I have bought this bonnet .

text: I do not think it is very pretty ; but I thought I might as well buy it as not .
text_tokenized: I do not think it is very pretty ; but I thought I might as well buy it as not .

text: I shall pull it to pieces as soon as I get home , and see if I can make it up any better . ”
text_tokenized: I shall pull it to pieces as soon as I get home , and see if I can make it up any better . ”

text: And when her sisters abused it as ugly , she added , with perfect unconcern , “ Oh , but there were two or three much uglier in the shop ; and when I have bought some prettier - coloured satin to trim it with fresh , I think it will be very tolerable .
text_tokenized: And when her sisters abused it as ugly , she added , with perfect unconcern , “ Oh , but there were two or three much uglier in the shop ; and when I have bought some prettier - coloured satin to trim it with fresh , I think it will be very tolerable .

text: Besides , it will not much signify what one wears this summer , after the ----shire have left Meryton , and they are going in a fortnight . ”
text_tokenized: Besides , it will not much signify what one wears this summer , after the ----shire have left Meryton , and they are going in a fortnight . ”

text: “ Are they , indeed ? ” cried Elizabeth , with the greatest satisfaction .
text_tokenized: “ Are they , indeed ? ” cried Elizabeth , with the greatest satisfaction .

text: “ They are going to be encamped near Brighton ; and I do so want papa to take us all there for the summer !
text_tokenized: “ They are going to be encamped near Brighton ; and I do so want papa to take us all there for the summer !

text: It would be such a delicious scheme , and I dare say would hardly cost anything at all .
text_tokenized: It would be such a delicious scheme , and I dare say would hardly cost anything at all .

text: Mamma would like to go , too , of all things !
text_tokenized: Mamma would like to go , too , of all things !

text: Only think what a miserable summer else we shall have ! ”
text_tokenized: Only think what a miserable summer else we shall have ! ”

text: “ Yes , ” thought Elizabeth ; “ _ that _ would be a delightful scheme , indeed , and completely do for us at once .
text_tokenized: “ Yes , ” thought Elizabeth ; “ _ that _ would be a delightful scheme , indeed , and completely do for us at once .

text: Good Heaven !
text_tokenized: Good Heaven !

text: Brighton and a whole campful of soldiers , to us , who have been overset already by one poor regiment of militia , and the monthly balls of Meryton ! ”
text_tokenized: Brighton and a whole campful of soldiers , to us , who have been overset already by one poor regiment of militia , and the monthly balls of Meryton ! ”

text: “ Now I have got some news for you , ” said Lydia , as they sat down to table .
text_tokenized: “ Now I have got some news for you , ” said Lydia , as they sat down to table .

text: “ What do you think ?
text_tokenized: “ What do you think ?

text: It is excellent news , capital news , and about a certain person that we all like . ”
text_tokenized: It is excellent news , capital news , and about a certain person that we all like . ”

text: Jane and Elizabeth looked at each other , and the waiter was told that he need not stay .
text_tokenized: Jane and Elizabeth looked at each other , and the waiter was told that he need not stay .

text: Lydia laughed , and said,-- “ Ay , that is just like your formality and discretion .
text_tokenized: Lydia laughed , and said,-- “ Ay , that is just like your formality and discretion .

text: You thought the waiter must not hear , as if he cared !
text_tokenized: You thought the waiter must not hear , as if he cared !

text: I dare say he often hears worse things said than I am going to say .
text_tokenized: I dare say he often hears worse things said than I am going to say .

text: But he is an ugly fellow !
text_tokenized: But he is an ugly fellow !

text: I am glad he is gone .
text_tokenized: I am glad he is gone .

text: I never saw such a long chin in my life .
text_tokenized: I never saw such a long chin in my life .

text: Well , but now for my news : it is about dear Wickham ; too good for the waiter , is not it ?
text_tokenized: Well , but now for my news : it is about dear Wickham ; too good for the waiter , is not it ?

text: There is no danger of Wickham ’s marrying Mary King -- there ’s for you !
text_tokenized: There is no danger of Wickham ’s marrying Mary King -- there ’s for you !

text: She is gone down to her uncle at Liverpool ; gone to stay .
text_tokenized: She is gone down to her uncle at Liverpool ; gone to stay .

text: Wickham is safe . ”
text_tokenized: Wickham is safe . ”

text: “ And Mary King is safe ! ” added Elizabeth ; “ safe from a connection imprudent as to fortune . ”
text_tokenized: “ And Mary King is safe ! ” added Elizabeth ; “ safe from a connection imprudent as to fortune . ”

text: “ She is a great fool for going away , if she liked him . ”
text_tokenized: “ She is a great fool for going away , if she liked him . ”

text: “ But I hope there is no strong attachment on either side , ” said Jane .
text_tokenized: “ But I hope there is no strong attachment on either side , ” said Jane .

text: “ I am sure there is not on _ his _ .
text_tokenized: “ I am sure there is not on _ his _ .

text: I will answer for it , he never cared three straws about her .
text_tokenized: I will answer for it , he never cared three straws about her .

text: Who _ could _ about such a nasty little freckled thing ? ”
text_tokenized: Who _ could _ about such a nasty little freckled thing ? ”

text: Elizabeth was shocked to think that , however incapable of such coarseness of _ expression _ herself , the coarseness of the _ sentiment _ was little other than her own breast had formerly harboured and fancied liberal !
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was shocked to think that , however incapable of such coarseness of _ expression _ herself , the coarseness of the _ sentiment _ was little other than her own breast had formerly harboured and fancied liberal !

text: As soon as all had ate , and the elder ones paid , the carriage was ordered ; and , after some contrivance , the whole party , with all their boxes , workbags , and parcels , and the unwelcome addition of Kitty ’s and Lydia ’s purchases , were seated in it .
text_tokenized: As soon as all had ate , and the elder ones paid , the carriage was ordered ; and , after some contrivance , the whole party , with all their boxes , workbags , and parcels , and the unwelcome addition of Kitty ’s and Lydia ’s purchases , were seated in it .

text: “ How nicely we are crammed in ! ” cried Lydia .
text_tokenized: “ How nicely we are crammed in ! ” cried Lydia .

text: “ I am glad I brought my bonnet , if it is only for the fun of having another band - box !
text_tokenized: “ I am glad I brought my bonnet , if it is only for the fun of having another band - box !

text: Well , now let us be quite comfortable and snug , and talk and laugh all the way home .
text_tokenized: Well , now let us be quite comfortable and snug , and talk and laugh all the way home .

text: And in the first place , let us hear what has happened to you all since you went away .
text_tokenized: And in the first place , let us hear what has happened to you all since you went away .

text: Have you seen any pleasant men ?
text_tokenized: Have you seen any pleasant men ?

text: Have you had any flirting ?
text_tokenized: Have you had any flirting ?

text: I was in great hopes that one of you would have got a husband before you came back .
text_tokenized: I was in great hopes that one of you would have got a husband before you came back .

text: Jane will be quite an old maid soon , I declare .
text_tokenized: Jane will be quite an old maid soon , I declare .

text: She is almost three - and - twenty !
text_tokenized: She is almost three - and - twenty !

text: Lord !
text_tokenized: Lord !

text: how ashamed I should be of not being married before three - and - twenty !
text_tokenized: how ashamed I should be of not being married before three - and - twenty !

text: My aunt Philips wants you so to get husbands you ca n’t think .
text_tokenized: My aunt Philips wants you so to get husbands you ca n’t think .

text: She says Lizzy had better have taken Mr. Collins ; but _ I _ do not think there would have been any fun in it .
text_tokenized: She says Lizzy had better have taken Mr. Collins ; but _ I _ do not think there would have been any fun in it .

text: Lord !
text_tokenized: Lord !

text: how I should like to be married before any of you !
text_tokenized: how I should like to be married before any of you !

text: and then I would _ chaperon _ you about to all the balls .
text_tokenized: and then I would _ chaperon _ you about to all the balls .

text: Dear me !
text_tokenized: Dear me !

text: we had such a good piece of fun the other day at Colonel Forster ’s !
text_tokenized: we had such a good piece of fun the other day at Colonel Forster ’s !

text: Kitty and me were to spend the day there , and Mrs. Forster promised to have a little dance in the evening ; ( by - the - bye , Mrs. Forster and me are _ such _ friends ! ) and so she asked the two Harringtons to come :
text_tokenized: Kitty and me were to spend the day there , and Mrs. Forster promised to have a little dance in the evening ; ( by - the - bye , Mrs. Forster and me are _ such _ friends ! ) and so she asked the two Harringtons to come :

text: but Harriet was ill , and so Pen was forced to come by herself ; and then , what do you think we did ?
text_tokenized: but Harriet was ill , and so Pen was forced to come by herself ; and then , what do you think we did ?

text: We dressed up Chamberlayne in woman ’s clothes , on purpose to pass for a lady,--only think what fun !
text_tokenized: We dressed up Chamberlayne in woman ’s clothes , on purpose to pass for a lady,--only think what fun !

text: Not a soul knew of it , but Colonel and Mrs. Forster , and Kitty and me , except my aunt , for we were forced to borrow one of her gowns ; and you can not imagine how well he looked !
text_tokenized: Not a soul knew of it , but Colonel and Mrs. Forster , and Kitty and me , except my aunt , for we were forced to borrow one of her gowns ; and you can not imagine how well he looked !

text: When Denny , and Wickham , and Pratt , and two or three more of the men came in , they did not know him in the least .
text_tokenized: When Denny , and Wickham , and Pratt , and two or three more of the men came in , they did not know him in the least .

text: Lord !
text_tokenized: Lord !

text: how I laughed !
text_tokenized: how I laughed !

text: and so did Mrs. Forster .
text_tokenized: and so did Mrs. Forster .

text: I thought I should have died .
text_tokenized: I thought I should have died .

text: And _ that _ made the men suspect something , and then they soon found out what was the matter .
text_tokenized: And _ that _ made the men suspect something , and then they soon found out what was the matter .

text: ” With such kind of histories of their parties and good jokes did Lydia , assisted by Kitty ’s hints and additions , endeavour to amuse her companions all the way to Longbourn .
text_tokenized: ” With such kind of histories of their parties and good jokes did Lydia , assisted by Kitty ’s hints and additions , endeavour to amuse her companions all the way to Longbourn .

text: Elizabeth listened as little as she could , but there was no escaping the frequent mention of Wickham ’s name .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth listened as little as she could , but there was no escaping the frequent mention of Wickham ’s name .

text: Their reception at home was most kind .
text_tokenized: Their reception at home was most kind .

text: Mrs. Bennet rejoiced to see Jane in undiminished beauty ; and more than once during dinner did Mr. Bennet say voluntarily to Elizabeth,---- “ I am glad you are come back , Lizzy . ”
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet rejoiced to see Jane in undiminished beauty ; and more than once during dinner did Mr. Bennet say voluntarily to Elizabeth,---- “ I am glad you are come back , Lizzy . ”

text: Their party in the dining - room was large , for almost all the Lucases came to meet Maria and hear the news ; and various were the subjects which occupied them : Lady Lucas was inquiring of Maria , across the table , after the welfare and poultry of her eldest daughter ; Mrs. Bennet was doubly engaged , on one hand collecting an account of the present fashions from Jane , who sat some way below her , and on the other , retailing them all to the younger Miss Lucases ; and Lydia , in a voice rather louder than any other person ’s , was enumerating the various pleasures of the morning to anybody who would hear her . “ Oh , Mary , ” said she , “ I wish you had gone with us , for we had such fun ! as we went along Kitty and me drew up all the blinds , and pretended there was nobody in the coach ; and I should have gone so all the way , if Kitty had not been sick ; and when we got to the George , I do think we behaved very handsomely , for we treated the other three with the nicest cold luncheon in the world , and if you would have gone , we would have treated you too .
text_tokenized: Their party in the dining - room was large , for almost all the Lucases came to meet Maria and hear the news ; and various were the subjects which occupied them : Lady Lucas was inquiring of Maria , across the table , after the welfare and poultry of her eldest daughter ; Mrs. Bennet was doubly engaged , on one hand collecting an account of the present fashions from Jane , who sat some way below her , and on the other , retailing them all to the younger Miss Lucases ; and Lydia , in a voice rather louder than any other person ’s , was enumerating the various pleasures of the morning to anybody who would hear her . “ Oh , Mary , ” said she , “ I wish you had gone with us , for we had such fun ! as we went along Kitty and me drew up all the blinds , and pretended there was nobody in the coach ; and I should have gone so all the way , if Kitty had not been sick ; and when we got to the George , I do think we behaved very handsomely , for we treated the other three with the nicest cold luncheon in the world , and if you would have gone , we would have treated you too .

text: And then when we came away it was such fun !
text_tokenized: And then when we came away it was such fun !

text: I thought we never should have got into the coach .
text_tokenized: I thought we never should have got into the coach .

text: I was ready to die of laughter .
text_tokenized: I was ready to die of laughter .

text: And then we were so merry all the way home !
text_tokenized: And then we were so merry all the way home !

text: we talked and laughed so loud , that anybody might have heard us ten miles off ! ”
text_tokenized: we talked and laughed so loud , that anybody might have heard us ten miles off ! ”

text: To this , Mary very gravely replied , “ Far be it from me , my dear sister , to depreciate such pleasures .
text_tokenized: To this , Mary very gravely replied , “ Far be it from me , my dear sister , to depreciate such pleasures .

text: They would doubtless be congenial with the generality of female minds .
text_tokenized: They would doubtless be congenial with the generality of female minds .

text: But I confess they would have no charms for _ me _ .
text_tokenized: But I confess they would have no charms for _ me _ .

text: I should infinitely prefer a book . ”
text_tokenized: I should infinitely prefer a book . ”

text: But of this answer Lydia heard not a word .
text_tokenized: But of this answer Lydia heard not a word .

text: She seldom listened to anybody for more than half a minute , and never attended to Mary at all .
text_tokenized: She seldom listened to anybody for more than half a minute , and never attended to Mary at all .

text: In the afternoon Lydia was urgent with the rest of the girls to walk to Meryton , and see how everybody went on ; but Elizabeth steadily opposed the scheme .
text_tokenized: In the afternoon Lydia was urgent with the rest of the girls to walk to Meryton , and see how everybody went on ; but Elizabeth steadily opposed the scheme .

text: It should not be said , that the Miss Bennets could not be at home half a day before they were in pursuit of the officers .
text_tokenized: It should not be said , that the Miss Bennets could not be at home half a day before they were in pursuit of the officers .

text: There was another reason , too , for her opposition .
text_tokenized: There was another reason , too , for her opposition .

text: She dreaded seeing Wickham again , and was resolved to avoid it as long as possible .
text_tokenized: She dreaded seeing Wickham again , and was resolved to avoid it as long as possible .

text: The comfort to _ her _ , of the regiment ’s approaching removal , was indeed beyond expression .
text_tokenized: The comfort to _ her _ , of the regiment ’s approaching removal , was indeed beyond expression .

text: In a fortnight they were to go , and once gone , she hoped there could be nothing more to plague her on his account .
text_tokenized: In a fortnight they were to go , and once gone , she hoped there could be nothing more to plague her on his account .

text: She had not been many hours at home , before she found that the Brighton scheme , of which Lydia had given them a hint at the inn , was under frequent discussion between her parents .
text_tokenized: She had not been many hours at home , before she found that the Brighton scheme , of which Lydia had given them a hint at the inn , was under frequent discussion between her parents .

text: Elizabeth saw directly that her father had not the smallest intention of yielding ; but his answers were at the same time so vague and equivocal , that her mother , though often disheartened , had never yet despaired of succeeding at last .
